title: The Blazing Sword
opening: Roy vowed to protect Lilina forever. However, with Bern coming full force at them, Roy's army wouldn't stand a chance. Therefore, they decided to try and take the Divine Weapons before Bern got their hands on them.
Lilina showed them to a cave in the outskirts of Ostia, where the first Divine Weapon was hidden. The cave, located at the foot of a volcano, was going to be a major ordeal for Roy.

intro.speaker: Bandit
intro.line: B-Boss! An army's invading our cave!

intro.speaker: Henning
intro.line: What! How many of them are there?

intro.speaker: Bandit
intro.line: Dunno, Boss. I hope there aren't too many of them...

intro.speaker: Henning
intro.line: That's strange... The Lycia marquesses should be having bigger problems than dealing with bandits like us.

intro.speaker: Bandit
intro.line: Well? What do we do?

intro.speaker: Henning
intro.line: They probably don't know much about this cave, anyway. Just lure them into stepping on the floor tiles where hot lava spurts and get rid of 'em.

intro.speaker: Lilina
intro.line: Roy, over here! The Divine Weapon is located on the other side of this lava pit.

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: Lilina, are you all right? Have you calmed down?

intro.speaker: Lilina
intro.line: Well... maybe I'm not fully all right, but now isn't the time to be sad. I need to protect Ostia, like my father before me.

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: All right... Good for you, Lilina.

intro.speaker: Lilina
intro.line: I'm okay because you're with me, Roy...

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: What? Did you just say something?

intro.speaker: Lilina
intro.line: No, nothing. Anyway, I'll tell you what I know about this Divine Weapon. The one here is the sword that was used by Roland, one of the 'Eight Heroes.'

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: That Roland... is that King Roland, the first king of Ostia?

intro.speaker: Lilina
intro.line: Right, he's our ancestor. This sword is called 'The Blazing Sword,' or the Durandal.

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: The Durandal... the name has a strange echo to it. So Roland used the Durandal to fight the Dragons during the Scouring.

intro.speaker: Lilina
intro.line: That's how the legend goes. They also say that after the war ended, Roland returned to his hometown of Ostia. He raised the Durandal high above his head, and the land that had become barren after the war suddenly became lush with vegetation and life again.

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: Wow... that must be some sword.

intro.speaker: Lilina
intro.line: Well, it's a weapon that can defeat Dragons. It must have some special powers in it.

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: Yes... Oh yeah, I heard that a group of bandits has made its base here. Is it going to be all right?

intro.speaker: Lilina
intro.line: ? Is what going to be all right?

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: I mean, there's always the chance that they might have taken the Durandal.

intro.speaker: Lilina
intro.line: No, don't worry. Only those who are Roland's successors know how to remove the Durandal from its sheath.

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: Oh, okay. Then everything is fine. All we have to do is to get rid of the bandits and obtain the Durandal.

boss.speaker: Henning
boss.line: Sigh. What are you guys doing in a place like this? Oh well, but since you're already here... I can't let you guys go, can I?

boss.speaker: Henning
boss.line: Crap... I knew this would happen...

end.speaker: Lilina
end.line: Roy! Here it is!

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: So this is the Durandal... It's a very large sword. I don't think many of us are going to be able to swing it.

end.speaker: Lilina
end.line: But history has it that Roland was a small man. I think it's the person's skill that determines whether he can use it or not.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Then if I become better with my sword, I can use it as well?

end.speaker: Lilina
end.line: Well... maybe.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Maybe? Come on... at least say 'probably.'

end.speaker: Lilina
end.line: Hee hee!

end.speaker: Merlinus
end.line: Master Roy! Bern's Dragon Knights have appeared at Castle Ostia!

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: What! They're here already?

end.speaker: Narcian
end.line: Hehehe... Are you Roy? I must thank you for getting rid of that idiot Leygance for me. Now, you will leave Ostia to me.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Don't be ridiculous! Who would give Ostia to the likes of you..!

end.speaker: Narcian
end.line: Oh? Then do you wish to fight us with that sad little group of yours? I shall annihilate you, as I did with Hector!

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Damn!
That's enough!

end.speaker: Soldier
end.line: General Narcian! A legion has arrived from Etruria!

end.speaker: Narcian
end.line: I can see that, you fool! Why...

end.speaker: Percival
end.line: I am Percival, Knight General of Etruria. Yesterday, Mage General Cecilia informed me that Ostia had requested Etruria's protection.

end.speaker: Narcian
end.line: What...!

end.speaker: Cecilia
end.line: You seem discontent. We are prepared for battle. But can those Dragon Knights of yours stand a chance against all of us?

end.speaker: Narcian
end.line: You...!

end.speaker: Cecilia
end.line: I am Cecilia, Mage General of Etruria! Ostia is now under our protection.

end.speaker: Narcian
end.line: Argh... You... you...!!!

end.speaker: Soldier
end.line: General Narcian, please control your temper! General Percival is one of the strongest warriors in Etruria! And with General Cecilia here as well we'll be slaughtered!

end.speaker: Narcian
end.line: I know! We're leaving! Cecilia, is it? Watch your back from now on!

end.speaker: Percival
end.line: Are you General Roy of the Lycia Alliance Army?

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Y-Yes! I am in charge of the Alliance Army in the place of Lord Hector.

end.speaker: Percival
end.line: I see. Lycia is in a time of hardship. Our king also sends his words of regret for Lord Hector's death.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Thank you for your consideration. If Etruria hadn't helped us... Ostia would be under Bern's control now. Thank you very much.

end.speaker: Percival
end.line: I'm not the one to thank. I simply followed my king's orders. You should thank Cecilia, who went against the king to help you.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: She... disobeyed the king's orders?

end.speaker: Percival
end.line: Yes, now isn't that something? Well, I must be off. Two of the three Etrurian Generals shouldn't be leaving the country for so long. Cecilia, can you take care of the rest?

end.speaker: Cecilia
end.line: Yes. Thank you, Percival. You can leave the rest to me.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Whew... General Percival... Now he's someone.

end.speaker: Cecilia
end.line: Nervous, were you?

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: General Cecilia! It is good to see you again.

end.speaker: Cecilia
end.line: How are you doing, Roy? You look a little tired, but you seem okay.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Yes, thanks to Etruria, we were able to avoid disaster.

end.speaker: Cecilia
end.line: I'm glad we made it here in time.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: I'm sorry. I put you through a lot of trouble.

end.speaker: Cecilia
end.line: No. It's going to be beneficial for Etruria for Ostia to go under our protection.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Beneficial?

end.speaker: Cecilia
end.line: Yes. Bern's been acting aggressively these days, as you know. We also want to do something about it, but since we haven't been directly invaded, we have no reason to go to war with them. But if Bern gets any stronger, the balance of powers would be shattered.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: So when Ostia requested protection, you saw it as a good reason to declare war on Bern?

end.speaker: Cecilia
end.line: Right. We just did what would be best for us. You don't need to feel that you're in our debt.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Yes.

end.speaker: Cecilia
end.line: So you shouldn't thank us.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Understood. I won't. Well anyway, come in and meet the rest of our army.

end.speaker: Cecilia
end.line: ... He's gotten so bold in the short time that I haven't seen him. Well, he is a boy, after all.
